title: Why did the French settle in Louisiana? - Quora

response.answer_text: For the same reasons the Spanish and Americans did. It’s a lousy port, but it’s the only one that serves the entire interior of the continent. New Orleans was built on the first (relatively) dry ground above the delta. Baton Rouge was further up an even more secure. With those two cities they controlled all the export traffic from the Missouri, Mississippi and Ohio river systems. A staggeringly vast area. From Colorado and Wyoming in the west to Pennsylvania in the East. Some of the cities served are Denver, St. Louis, Minneapolis, Cincinnati and Pittsburgh.
